title: Ticket #135: Make running  a subset of tests in NMI easy
description: It should be easy to run just a subset of the tests in an NMI build. This would speed up the development cycle if you're developing a new test, or working on a small subsection of code. This is probably possible right now, but it's not obvious how. Indeed, the fix may just be better documentation.
remarks:
--test-args="Imake class name"

All tests can be in multiple classes. I keep one called btdebug and swap out which tests are assigned to it in the condor_tests Imakefile. Pete has busted up some of the others... into different classes.

However running concurrently I can run the entire gaunlet in about 45 minutes and there is something to be said for a complete sweep of the tests.
